description: The kingdom ruled by the Neptune royal family on Fish-Man Island, located 10,000 meters below sea level.

keyEvents.title: Queen Otohime's Advocacy
keyEvents.description: Queen Otohime advocates for peaceful coexistence with humans from Ryugu Kingdom.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes the kingdom as the center of Otohime's peace movement.

keyEvents.title: Fisher Tiger Reports to Neptune
keyEvents.description: Fisher Tiger meets with King Neptune at Ryugu Palace to reveal his actions at Mary Geoise.
keyEvents.significance: The kingdom's leadership learns of Tiger's legendary raid.

description: The royal palace of the Ryugu Kingdom where King Neptune and his family reside.

keyEvents.title: Fisher Tiger Arrives at Palace
keyEvents.description: Fisher Tiger arrives at Ryugu Palace to meet with King Neptune.
keyEvents.significance: Setting for Tiger's revelation about freeing slaves from Mary Geoise.

description: A large public plaza on Fish-Man Island where Queen Otohime gives speeches and gathers petition signatures for her cause.

keyEvents.title: Otohime's Petition Speech
keyEvents.description: Queen Otohime delivers a passionate speech at Gyoncorde Plaza, advocating for peaceful coexistence with humans.
keyEvents.significance: The public forum for Otohime's peace movement and petition gathering.

description: An island located 10,000 meters below sea level, home to fish-men and merfolk. It serves as an underwater waypoint for pirates heading to the New World.

keyEvents.title: Island-Wide Celebration of Tiger's Heroism
keyEvents.description: News of Fisher Tiger's raid on Mary Geoise spreads across all of Fish-Man Island, causing island-wide celebration.
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates the profound impact of Tiger's actions on fish-man society.

description: Originally an institution for orphaned children, it became a lawless district where outcasts of Fish-Man Island gathered. Fisher Tiger declared himself the boss and protected fish-men living there.

keyEvents.title: Fish-Man District Residents Join Sun Pirates
keyEvents.description: Arlong and others from the Fish-Man District join the Sun Pirates under Fisher Tiger.
keyEvents.significance: The district that produced many Sun Pirates members including Arlong and Jinbe.

statusHistory.reason: District exists as a lawless area

description: The holy land of the World Government located atop the Red Line, home to the World Nobles (Celestial Dragons). Site of Fisher Tiger's legendary slave liberation raid.

keyEvents.title: Tiger's Experience at Mary Geoise
keyEvents.description: Fisher Tiger reveals he witnessed horrors at Mary Geoise when he was enslaved there.
keyEvents.significance: Reveals the traumatic slavery that motivated Tiger's raid.

keyEvents.title: The Ransacking of Mary Geoise
keyEvents.description: Flashback reveals Fisher Tiger's raid 15 years ago where he climbed the Red Line and freed all slaves.
keyEvents.significance: One of the most significant acts of rebellion in One Piece history.
